author: Nic1306
title: Another Minecraft polybag
review:
General infos about the set:

The set has 2 minifigs and comes with 22 parts. The set got releassed in 2020 as second minecradft polybag.

Minifigs:

Teh two minifgs coming in this set are Alex and a skeleton. Both of the minifigs arent exclusive with this, but the selection is good.

Parts:

As said in the other review the parts are cool, but the build not so. I partet it out and used the parts for MOCs. I think so there in better use, also because there isnt to much playabilty, but every one can do what he wants.

Overall:

Good minifigs, cool parts and low price, a must buy.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Alex Arrives for 4.99$ CND
review:
Set #30394 The Skeleton Defense: This is the second Polybag set from LEGO Minecraft and it features some bit of terrain to attach to your larger models, two Minifigures and is definitely worth picking up.

Pros:

  • Includes Skeleton and Alex Minifigures as well as appropriate tools for combat/defense.
  • Small model built includes flick-fire missile for defense and some carrots starting to grow in perhaps.
  • Decent parts-per-piece ratio

Cons:

  • No unique printed Minecraft bricks.

Overall opinion

This is an excellent little Polybag, it is great abundance at Wal-Marts around Canada and so should be picked up when seen. The parts are quite useful and the Minifigures look great. Overall a very solid offering from Minecraft. Recommended.

author: graymattr
title: Minecraft minifigs value set
review:
My youngest son started playing Minecraft about seven years ago when he was 11 and while I don't play, I think it's really valuable for young kids.  I got this polybag set because of the minifigures -- I like the 8-bit printing and block shaped heads, and I love all Lego skeletons so this was an easy decision.  Both minifigs also come with a Minecraft accessory, a pickaxe and bow and arrow.

The set comes with some vegetation for kids to claim in their Lego Minecraft harvesting and the flick missile is fun for kids.  The rest of it is very basic.

This polybag is a great deal at $5 for two minifigs and some extra Lego pieces thrown in.  On that basis alone, I would recommend it.

title: The Skeleton Defense
review:

A good price, but a mediocre set.
